results.title: Association between antidiabetic drugs and the incidence of atrial fibrillation in patients with type 2 diabetes: A nationwide cohort study in South Korea.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ included (mean age, 62 +- 11 years; 60 % @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@), 89,125 were newly diagnosed with @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@AF@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@) alone (hazard ratio [HR] 0.959, 95 % CI 0.935-0.985) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ combination therapy (HR < 1) significantly decreased the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@AF@@@ compared to the no-medication group.

citations.NLM: Kim S, Park SY, Kim B, Min C, Cho W, Yon DK, Kim JY, Han KD, Rhee EJ, Lee WY, Rhee SY. Association between antidiabetic drugs and the incidence of atrial fibrillation in patients with type 2 diabetes: A nationwide cohort study in South Korea. Diabetes Res Clin Pract. 2023 Apr;198():110626. PMID: 36933806
